page.title: 08B.B.C. Llandaff.
page.content: The B.B.C. studios were opened by Princess Margaret on 1st March 1967. About 1600 people work here, mainly cameramen, journalists and researchers. The studios make news, religious, farming, sport, Welsh drama and light entertainment programmes for television. They make programmes for BBC Wales, and S4C, some of these go out nationally. Their most popular programmes are on Rugby and the news. Newspaper reporters tip off the BBC and get paid depending on how important the story is. Sometimes gathering news is dangerous, especially for cameramen situations like the Falklands or in climbing accidents. The studio also make 80 hours of radio programmes in English and 70 hours in Welsh. Lots of famous people visit the studios e.g. Dr. Who.
